Package com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.impl.util

Class ServerGameContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.demilich.metastone.game.GameContext
      • com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.impl.util.ServerGameContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Server, ClientConnectionHandler, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<GameContext>, EntityZoneTable, Inventory
    public class ServerGameContext
extends GameContext
implements Server
    A networked game context from the server's point of view.

    In addition to storing game state, this class also stores references to Client objects that (1) get notified when game state changes and how, and (2) allow this class to Behaviour.requestAction(GameContext, Player, List) and Behaviour.mulligan(GameContext, Player, List) over a network.

    This class also automatically adds support for persistence effects written on cards using a PersistenceTrigger.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getMessagesFromClientAddress

        @NotNull
public static java.lang.String getMessagesFromClientAddress​(java.lang.String userId)
        Represents the address on the event bus to which the client sends its outgoing messages.

        Messages consumed from this address will be arriving from the web socket and received by the server infrastructure (typically).

        Parameters:
        userId - The user from whom messages will arrive
        Returns:

      • getMessagesFromServerAddress

        @NotNull
public static java.lang.String getMessagesFromServerAddress​(java.lang.String userId)
        Represents the address on the event bus to which the client receives incoming messages.

        Messages sent to this address will be written to the web socket and received by the Unity client.

        Parameters:
        userId - The user to whom messages should be delivered
        Returns:

      • init

        @Suspendable
public void init()
        Initializes a game.

        This function will choose a starting player, then move cards into the mulligan (set aside) zone, ask for mulligans, and start the game. GameContext.resume() will start the first turn.

        Simultaneously processes mulligans and awaits until all human players have sent a "FIRST_MESSAGE."

        Overrides:
        init in class GameContext

      • play

        @Suspendable
public void play​(boolean fork)
        Plays the game. GameContext.play() is eventually called.
        Overrides:
        play in class GameContext
        Parameters:
        fork - When false, blocks until the game is done. Otherwise, plays the game inside a Fiber
